channel.title: News : NPR
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2023 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Oscar Pistorius, Paralympian convicted of murder, to be released on parole
item.description: A South African corrections board found the athlete had meet the minimum parole requirements after serving half of his 13-year sentence for murder.
item.content:encoded:
A South African corrections board found the athlete had meet the minimum parole requirements after serving half of his 13-year sentence for murder.

(Image credit: Pool/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Emily Olson

item.title: Watching war unfold is distressing â€” here's how to protect your mental health
item.description: Doomscrolling won't help the people who are suffering and it might put you into a state of chronic stress. A psychiatrist who works with trauma shares advice for how to process global tragedy.
item.content:encoded:
Doomscrolling won't help the people who are suffering and it might put you into a state of chronic stress. A psychiatrist who works with trauma shares advice for how to process global tragedy.

(Image credit: MAHMUD HAMS/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Malaka Gharib

item.title: A car-sized tumbleweed made quite a scene on a California highway
item.description: A person shared video of "the mother of all tumbleweeds" on social media this week. That got us thinking about where tumbleweeds come from and their propensity for taking over roads and neighborhoods.
item.content:encoded:
A person shared video of "the mother of all tumbleweeds" on social media this week. That got us thinking about where tumbleweeds come from and their propensity for taking over roads and neighborhoods.

(Image credit: @tuidelescribano/Screen shot by NPR)
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Romo

item.title: U.S. airlines lose 2 million suitcases a year. Where do they all go?
item.description: When luggage and its owner can't be reunited, airlines sell it to a store in Alabama, where its contents are sold to the public. The result is a grab bag of normal and odd things people travel with.
item.content:encoded:
When luggage and its owner can't be reunited, airlines sell it to a store in Alabama, where its contents are sold to the public. The result is a grab bag of normal and odd things people travel with.

(Image credit: Melanie Peeples/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Melanie Peeples

item.title: First Lady Rosalynn Carter's legacy on mental health boils down to one word: Hope
item.description: The former first lady fought with persistence to put care for mental and physical health on equal footing and to eliminate discrimination toward people with mental illnesses.
item.content:encoded:
The former first lady fought with persistence to put care for mental and physical health on equal footing and to eliminate discrimination toward people with mental illnesses.

(Image credit: MANDEL NGAN/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Christine Herman

item.title: Why are sales so hard to resist? Let's unravel this Black Friday mystery
item.description: The human brain has to really fight the lure of a discount. Companies know this and use many tricks to push our buttons. But there's a way to outsmart them.
item.content:encoded:
The human brain has to really fight the lure of a discount. Companies know this and use many tricks to push our buttons. But there's a way to outsmart them.

(Image credit: Ahn Young-joon/AP)
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: How OpenAI's origins explain the Sam Altman drama
item.description: The company's non-profit board and for-profit arm have long been at odds. CEO Sam Altman's week-long ouster represents the culmination of that long-simmering tension.
item.content:encoded:
The company's non-profit board and for-profit arm have long been at odds. CEO Sam Altman's week-long ouster represents the culmination of that long-simmering tension.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci/AP)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Release of Palestinians follows Israelis and foreigners during temporary Gaza truce
item.description: Hamas released 13 Israelis and 11 Thai and Filipino workers who were also seized in Hamas' deadly attack on Israel last month. In exchange, Israel has freed 39 Palestinian prisoners.
item.content:encoded:
Hamas released 13 Israelis and 11 Thai and Filipino workers who were also seized in Hamas' deadly attack on Israel last month. In exchange, Israel has freed 39 Palestinian prisoners.

(Image credit: Alexi J. Rosenfeld/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Violent clashes break out in Dublin after knife attack
item.description: Violent clashes broke out in Dublin on Thursday evening after a 5-year-old girl was seriously injured in a knife attack earlier in the day that also saw a woman and two other children hospitalized.
item.content:encoded:
Violent clashes broke out in Dublin on Thursday evening after a 5-year-old girl was seriously injured in a knife attack earlier in the day that also saw a woman and two other children hospitalized.

(Image credit: Brian Lawless/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Stache the Sealyham terrier wins the National Dog Show
item.description: Stache lives in Honey Brook, Pa., not far from where he picked up today's prestigious Best in Show award. The Kennel Club of Philadelphia hosts the annual contest that's televised on Thanksgiving Day.
item.content:encoded:
Stache lives in Honey Brook, Pa., not far from where he picked up today's prestigious Best in Show award. The Kennel Club of Philadelphia hosts the annual contest that's televised on Thanksgiving Day.

(Image credit: Bill McCay/NBC)
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: Cleanup, air monitoring underway at Kentucky train derailment site
item.description: Crews with rail operator CSX and Kentucky officials are working to remove train cars and spilled material at the site of a derailment that sparked a chemical fire and prompted home evacuations.
item.content:encoded:
Crews with rail operator CSX and Kentucky officials are working to remove train cars and spilled material at the site of a derailment that sparked a chemical fire and prompted home evacuations.

(Image credit: WTVQ via/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Disgusted by city's top prosecutor, a police officer refuses to testify
item.description: In an extreme example of resistance to progressive prosecutors, a St. Louis police officer is refusing to testify in murder cases he investigated, even though he believes the defendants are guilty.
item.content:encoded: In an extreme example of resistance to progressive prosecutors, a St. Louis police officer is refusing to testify in murder cases he investigated, even though he believes the defendants are guilty.
item.dc:creator: Sacha Pfeiffer

item.title: WHO asks China for more information about rise in illnesses and pneumonia clusters
item.description: The World Health Organization has asked China to provide data on a spike in pneumonia and bacterial lung infections in children there.
item.content:encoded:
The World Health Organization has asked China to provide data on a spike in pneumonia and bacterial lung infections in children there.

(Image credit: Andy Wong/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: We visited a camp for Palestinians and heard despair for Gaza â€” and anger at America
item.description: We came to a refugee camp in Jordan to ask what is on people's minds, as war and violence unfold in places that may be miles away, but that feel central to their identities.
item.content:encoded:
We came to a refugee camp in Jordan to ask what is on people's minds, as war and violence unfold in places that may be miles away, but that feel central to their identities.

(Image credit: Ayman Oghanna for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Erika Ryan

item.title: Could a 'funky' pathogen be sickening dogs? Scientists search for clues
item.description: Dogs around the country are becoming sick with an unknown respiratory illness. Some veterinarians are warning dog owners to take precautions. A strange bacterium could be involved.
item.content:encoded:
Dogs around the country are becoming sick with an unknown respiratory illness. Some veterinarians are warning dog owners to take precautions. A strange bacterium could be involved.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Will Stone
